content.description: Brief bouldery sequence at bottom with a long move. Easier climbing leads you to a bulge with curious moves that have you feeling like you are topping out a boulder.
content.location: About 15ft to right of the 5.10. There is a small clearing behind the short trees.

content.description: This climb is generally considered the approach pitch to set up TRs for the other routes. Features some fairly easy slab moves protected by bolts.
content.protection: Quickdraws. Multiple sets of anchors one could belay from around the top of the crag.
content.location: Look for bolts heading up the lowest angle part of the crag, near the toe of the large bluff. The first bolt is missing a hanger, so bring a nut for it.

climbs.name: A Stone Alone, Awa
climbs.fa: James Garrett and  Tim Toula, September 2001

content.description: This route climbs over several slabby bulges with intricate crimps. The business starts right off the deck with another crux mid way up then another at the roof.
content.location: Starting from the top of a small plant covered dune this route follows the obvious bolt line up the face to a bulgy roof.
